Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in March and found the hotel to be exceptionally clean, friendly and stylish. Upon arriving at the hotel Isabelle, the owner, greeted us with the news that the travel agent I had booked with hadn't paid for our room even though I had paid them. She allowed me to use the hotel phone to call England to try and rectify the issue and was extremely pleasant throughout the process. While waiting for the travel agent to call us back she gave us some drinks and snacks on the house. After a couple of hours the problem had been resolved and because of the trouble she upgraded us to a more superior room at no extra cost. Our room was fantastic, so to was breakfast and any other contact we had with the hotel staff over the course of our stay. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Paris. It is in a very nice area, got all the essential amenities close by, nice restaurants and bars. I will certainly be staying here again if / when I visit Paris again. Jon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dave201253
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights with my wife in March 2012. I initially chose the location for its proximity to Eurostar at Gare du Nord, just a short 10 minute stroll away. The Metro (Cadet) is 5 minutes away so all of Paris is really on the doorstep. We did plenty of walking though and could be at the Opera and shops on Bvd Hausmann in no time. A gentle morning stroll also found us in Montmartre with lovely views across Paris. The hotel say they do room service but we never used this owing to the wide variety of local eating options. The breakfast costs extra but is a good feed of croissants, rolls, fruits, juice, cheese, etc. The staff were friendly and seemed appreciative of my stabs at French although they speak English just fine. The free wifi had me tearing my hair out at times though with connections continually dropping in our room. The room was on the ground floor and was big enough for our purposes. It was clean and the bed comfortable. A mini bar is available and so is French TV. The wet room shower was excellent - a real pleasure. I've stayed in so many hotels where the shower is a disappointment of dribbling water, sometimes hot and sometimes cold but this was up there with the best. The Hotel de la Tour d'Auvergne helped make our first trip to Paris a most enjoyable experience. I certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Paris boutique hotel with 5 Star service!”
Reviews.Author: Duchysue
Reviews.Content: Having booked a bargain break with Railbookers via Eurostar to Gare du Nord, we did wonder what sort of hotel we would get at this bargain price but we were delighted! Hotel de la Tour d'Auvergne is a really super hotel, on a quiet street, friendly and helpful staff - even with our limited French! Great room, well furnished and warm but not too hot and the window opened, which is a bonus! Fabulous and generous Continental breakfast, juice, fruit, yogurt plus mini pastries, lovely butter and jams, wonderful coffee (avoid tea unless you take your own teabags!!) - kept us going til mid afternoon, which saved the cost of one meal each day and given that Paris is pretty expensive anyway, this was another plus! Beds were very comfortable and the shower powerful and efficient - shower room/toilet not huge but it is not a priority on a budget break!! Local facilities were wonderful, great cafes and small, typically French food shops - enjoy it all and worry about the weight when you get back!!! Walking distance of the beautiful Sacre Coeur and fantastic views across Paris - as well as into L'Opera and the main sights. Indeed a perfect place to stay! I will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Easy access for Paris”
Reviews.Author: snabelabel
Reviews.Content: My two brothers and I stayed at this hotel during January 2012. Found it on Tripadvisor. We chose this hotel as the RER from Charles De Gaule arrives at Gare de Nord and there is a 6 min walking distance from the station. Line #7 runs just below so from the hotel you can access the centre in a short amount of time. The hotel interior design is modern and the stylish, as the hotel room. The breakfast is not a buffet, you are being served a plate of cheese, yoghurt, pancake and some bread. Together with croissants, jam, juice and coffee. I rather have it like this instead of a large buffet. So I can only recommend the breakfast. The staff is friendly and helpful and you are able to store your luggage on leaving day. I hope I'll return to Paris soon, and if so I'd consider staying at Tour d'Auvergne again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, kind staff”
Reviews.Author: peter m
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel four nights. Staff is really very kind and helpful. The hotel is situated at walking distance from Gare du Nord and Montmartre. Because of the many metro stations all of Paris is at your feet. The room is modern and clean. Breakfast is a feast, fresh croissants, fruit salad, fruit juice etc. At these prices a real good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and genuine Paris location”
Reviews.Author: Bluelines
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on the way to London. It is a small, stylish boutique hotel not far from the Paris Nord station. I opted for a larger premium room which had an exquisite interior design. Very cool! The service was friendly and helpful. The only downside, the room was on the ground floor facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Drsquid
Reviews.Content: I can't fault this hotel at all. I definitely will stay here again when I am next in town. Hotel - good position.Quite road, beautiful decor both inside and out. Thoughtfully decorated. Position about 10 mins from Gare du Nord, 5 mins to the nearest metro - cadet/Poissonere. That is the pink line which goes straight to La fayette (city centre) and also de Louvre thus no need to change. Free safe and secure baggage storage after you check out. Sacre coure is only 10 mins walk from the hotel. Room - what can I say? Quiet, romantic, beautiful decor, LCD tv with option for English language if you can work out the system (we did!), decent enough toiletries but I have always preferred my own. Bathrrom + shower so that is handy. There's hairdryer. The closet is small but enough for the two of us (we stayed for 4 nights). Lift is very small but that is no suprise from Paris old building. We loved it. And fantastic mattress - so so comfortable! And it was winter - room was not too hot and perfect warmth. Breakfast - lasts us till 2 pm and we have around 9 am. Croissonts, crepes, yoghurt, option for hot chocolate, tea, fresh coffee - beautifully presented. Staff - marvellous! Isabelle is lovely, always smiling, helpful and definitely been very good when I contacted her via email. We had no trouble at all and would like to say thank you to their attentive service! I don't think there's much of a downside to this place - nearby there's lots of eatery places, pharmacy, boulangere etc. It is NOT the centre of Paris but with the metro you are only 10 mins ride away from metro. We walked from hotel to the Seine and that took us about 35 to 50 mins or so. Overall highly recommended! Oh the wi-fi is crap but who cares.. I was in Paris.. and I rather spend time looking round then fumbling about on the wi-fi telling half the world how crap the connection is .

Reviews.Title: “5 Star treatment”
Reviews.Author: 290Flossie71
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Isobelle, the lady that runs it is SO friendly, relaxed and a perfect hostess. The decoration is of a high standard and it's SO clean. The setting is charming and breakfasting there is a treat. we sat up at the high communal table, but equally if you wanted a bit of privacy you could have your own table. The coffee was great too. Later on that morning when we asked for another, we were brought a tray containing the coffee accompanied by a glass of water and a plateful of cream eclairs! They were to die for. All in all nothing to complain about and a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “No big complaints”
Reviews.Author: Senateguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights during the last week of November. We booked it through hotwire and got a good rate. The hotel isn't in the city center and is a short walk from the metro, but it worked out pretty well. The lady who runs it isn't the friendliest lady in town and doesn't seem to really like Americans, but she keeps the hotel clean and efficient. And at the end of the day, that's all we cared about. We stayed in room 51 which was on the fifth floor. It had two twin beds and was a good size room for french standards and the bathroom was pretty nice. The hotel is kept clean and is quiet. The hotel has a grocery store just around the corner from it which is very convenient for out of towners who want to buy some water, soda, or snacks. The Gard De Nord tran station is very close by too. It's about five blocks away. In fact we took a cab from the train station when we arrived, but we actually walked with our luggage to it when we left. The closet metro stop is the Cadet stop which is about four blocks from the hotel. That stop works well because it's on the line that runs downtown to the Louve and the main city centre. This was my first trip to Paris, so the hotel worked well and was a good rate, but I will probably not stay there again because it's too far from the parts of town I like which is the left bank or the Champs. No major complaints though and if you stay here it will probably work well for the right price. We paid $125 a night through hotwire. Also, the hostess was very nice to let us bring our bags to the hotel prior to our check-in time and also let us leave them for the day once we checked out, because our flight didn't leave until that evening. All and all - it's a good place. The owner would do a lot better if she just smiled a little more though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yiannakis81
Reviews.Content: After searching for hours online to find a nice hotel in Paris with good value, we found and booked in this hotel. And we are very happy we made that choice as it met all our expectations! The location is very convenient in a nice neighborhood and the service is professional and friendly. Room was spacious, very clean, French style, being classic and modern at the same time. Definitely recommend this hotel for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “70th Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: Surreytripper_11
Reviews.Content: Booked via Railbookers for three couples celebrating a 70th birthday. Hotel more than met all expectations. Rooms eclecticaly different but all comfortable and welcoming and above all clean. Location excellent for sight-seeing and shopping with many attractions being within a 15-20 minute walk.Many restaurants within similar distance to cover all tastes and prices.Reception staff were all extremely helpful and ever cheerful with suggestions for travel by bus and metro when asked. Taxis, when requested for special outings, were promptly ordered and arrived in good time. Breakfast was more than sufficient to get the day underway with plenty of good coffee. This hotel definitely helped to make the birthday weekend a success

Reviews.Title: “Great little Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leelee_813
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel near the Garde du Nord train station. We stayed for 4 nights and was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and service for the price. The receptionist, Sebastion was very helpful and a pleasure. My only complaint was that there is a large cut out from the bedroom staring directly into the shower and toilet area of the bathroom. Yes, the bathroom! Not for the faint of heart or newly coupled. Aww, the French are so romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the 9th district”
Reviews.Author: dc167
Reviews.Content: We got a beautiful large room. The hotel also has tiny rooms for a much lower price. Our room was unusually attractive and the bathroom was very chic with good fixtures. The room was very very quiet day and night. It wasn't especially comfortable, though, and the hotel management seems to save on supplies. The weather was rather warm yet we only had a heavy comforter, no top sheet or light blanket. Bathroom supplies were not replenished unless we made a special request. The staff were remarkable friendly and helpful. The neighborhood is pleasant, with food stores next door. The metro stations are not close but several bus lines stop near the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance from Sacre Coeur, the Opera Garnier, and the Grand Boulevards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a little style over function”
Reviews.Author: mlewi100
Reviews.Content: We spent bank holiday weekend here and had booked feeling reasonably confident based on the previous reviews. The hotel is in a great location, just south of the Montmartre district and only 10 mins walk for the Gare de Nord rail station. The welcome was warm and efficient and we were shown to our room. It's quite a stylish hotel and our room had the front of a Fiat 500 on the wall with working lights which looked cool. Due to being a ground floor room, it was quite dark and so lighting had to be used all the time. Due to being a boutique type hotel I was quite surprised by the lack of toiletries in the bathroom. This stay was a bit of a treat, but the only complementary items were two mini bars of soap and a shower cap. Now, you get these items at an Etap or Formula 1 hotel and I guess I expected something a little better as the cost saving can't be that great. The shower itself was excellent though. The only other complaint I would have is that the downstairs rooms are next to the breakfast area and despite the inclusion of a small hallway the noise can be quite loud from this area. It did mean that we were awoken at 6am by the sound of cups and plates being arranged for breakfast. I suppose we could have asked for a room change, but we were settled by the point we found out, so a pillow over the head worked instead! Maybe it would be a better idea to lay the table for breakfast the night before? If I hadn't had these complaints I would have given it a rating of 4 as the location and helpfulness of the staff was excellent. I would recommend it to others, but I would just avoid the downstairs rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very quiet, with lovely clean rooms, although we found the room to be a bit on the small side, compared to others we had stayed in throughout Europe. We found lots of local shops and Patisseries to be closed for summer holidays, with many opening just after our visit to Paris, however the Boulevard De Rochenchouart was within easy walking distance to Cafes and Restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but not central”
Reviews.Author: 24edith
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights in august 2011 my husband and I. We were pleased by the cleaness of the hotel. The entrance was well decorated, which was a good sign for the room. The staff was nice and friendly too. And helpful! Our room was on the third floor and the hotel is located on a quiet street so it was quiet even if the room was on the street side. The a/c fonctionned well and the bathroom was recently renovated, small, but very good. No bath but a good shower and enough hot water at every time of the day.The bed was comfy. And there is a very small lift you can use for your luggages. We didn't take the breakfast at the hotel, it was to expensive (9 euros). But there is a great bakery on the corner of the street and a grocery too. You have to walk fort about 10 minutes for the nearest subway station. There's a lot of cafés and restaurants in the aera but in august, most of all were closed for the vacations so we had to walk a lot to find some with good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel! Good location! Good room and good staff!”
Reviews.Author: Anna72_11
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay at this hotel. This is a small lovely hotel situated perfectly near major places to visit in Paris. We arrived 4 hours before check-in but it was no trouble to allow us to check-in early. We also store our luggage for several hours after check-out, it was great. The staff there was terrific, extremely friendly!!! The room looks very nice and clean. Free wifi worked very well so it’s a plus. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doingcool
Reviews.Content: Such a lovely hotel. Very clean, nicely decorated and very helpful staff. Couldnt ask for more. Excellent value for money. will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn’t fault it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: philip Y
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd visit to Paris and of course this is my 3rd stay at the hotel la tour d’Auvergne Opéra. The staff was really nice, polite and willing to help us. Our suite was a big size for Paris, it’s beautifully decorated, well equipped and comfortable. i would recommend this hotel without any doubt. i loved Paris therefore i would love to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Victoria298
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights and really enjoyed our holiday in Paris. Not only because the hotel has a good location ( in the 9arr near the Opera Garnier, the Galeries Lafaytte and many interesting sights), the staffs were terrific, they are so friendly and helpful. The room in the hotel was spacious, the bed was comfortable. All in one, this hotel made our holiday unforgettable and we will stay there next time when we come back to this magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home!”
Reviews.Author: suri k
Reviews.Content: In June 2011, I decided to travel Europe alone, Paris, more preciously the hotel la Tour d’Auvergne Opera is my first destination. I think this hotel represented a good value for Paris. Even though I arrived two hours before standard check-in time, I only had to wait 5 minutes for my room. I liked the hotel and room decorations, I loved the super friendly service which made me feel like home‼! The staff was helpful, gave me a map, pointing out some sights to go and some nice restaurants to eat. If I have enough money to come back Paris, I’ll stay here without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent base for a paris break”
Reviews.Author: almalmac
Reviews.Content: Excellent base for a Paris break convenient to tourist spots and Cadet Metro. Would definitely stay there on our next visit. Lovely quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkareno
Reviews.Content: I was used to tiny hotel rooms in Europe so was very pleasantly suprised when I saw how large our room was and tastefully decorated. But the best part was the lovely woman who worked the front desk during the week--she couldn't have been more helpful. We skipped their breakfast because there was a wonderful boulangerie right at the corner where we could get our morning baguette. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: BrettloP
Reviews.Content: Arrived to an easy checkin process with staff that speak english. Was given a complementary upgrade to a premium room due to a cancellation of another guest. Excellent room with individual designer furnishings. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Good location, easy walk to the large train station, Grand du Nord, as well as lively local Montmartre area. Will stay again and definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: linda195
Reviews.Content: Love it and definately will stay in the same hotel if we do return to Paris again. The hotel has a lovely and charming decor which makes it special and unforgettable. The double room was quiet, clean, nice and well furnished; the bed was comfortable that set us up each day. The hotel is only a few minutes away from the centre by the nearby metro, it’s also close to the Opera garnier and the Galerie la Fayette, two “must-see” places in Paris. About the staff, they are all excellent and incredibly friendly and helpful giving us many good advices. Thanks again for everything we’ve received. I would definitely stay here again if I come to France.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay! Woudl love to return!”
Reviews.Author: Ines2012
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay in the hotel La Tour d’Auvergne Opera with my parents and my little sister (10years old) and we were very surprised of the experiences we had there. Like most travelers, we had read a lot of reviews on TripAdvisors before booking the hotel room, so we were prepared that rooms in Paris would be small. But in fact, the hotel surpassed our expectations. We had a large, spacious and comfortable room. The hotel itself is lovely and charming. The receptionist was extremely helpful and friendly. We do love the mini-bar conception of this hotel. It made me feel like at home. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved This Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: ian_dawn2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found this hotel to be clean and comfortable, and the decor to be very pleasing. The staff, especially Isabel, were very friendly and quick to assist with our needs. We highly recommend this hotel and will stay here when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwibloke012
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The room was clean and had a quaint boutique atmosphere. The bathroom was good and the beds very comfortable. The hotel is well situated and there are many shops and restaurants close by. The staff were pleasant, which we appreciated very much, since almost without exception, every other Parisian was rude, arrogant, aggressive or a combination of all 3. In fact, the rudeness of the people was such that we will probably never return to Paris, but if we did, we would certainly choose to stay at this hotel again. Finally, the continental breakfast is really excellent and the African woman who served the breakfast each day deserves special mention; she was just delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky boutique hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: maximised_10
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff with warm welcome and helpful with our enquiries. We loved our room and had a peep in the others while rooms were being changed and were very impressed, although the rooms are small, they are more than adequate and the bathrooms are of high standard. The lift is small but we managed the stairs easily to the 3rd floor when it was occupied. The location is perfect with easy walking/metro access and the breakfast was very pretty and sufficient. Unfortunately we were unable to access the bar or facilities as they were being decorated, and no tea and coffee facilities were available in the room, so we kept pestering the reception staff for refreshments who did not hesitate to provide on request, at any hour. we would definitely return and enjoyed our 3 day christmas stay

Reviews.Title: “they aren't very friendly to American travelers”
Reviews.Author: sportsprgirl
Reviews.Content: My family and I were on a multi country vacation with Paris being our last stop. Our travel agent knew we had five in our group and had booked all other rooms in other cities with 3 in a double room and 2 in another. We arrived at check in only to be told that we cannot put 3 people in a room even though they are students and can fit in the double bed. The manager Isabella did not speak good english so it came out very harsh. She told us "One of you MUST leave rigt now" We were quite taken aback. It was fashion week so there was no other hotels in the city. She said it wasnt her problem and we needed to leave now. Not only were we asked to leave but were told that since we didnt give a 24 hour notice we would be charged for the two rooms that we could not check in to. It was quite a scene. Long story short, the management staff is horrible, the rooms are super tiny and if you stay on the 5th floor you have to walk up one flight of stairs as the elevator only goes as high as the 4th floor. The tiny room smells dank and wasnt very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Under No Circumstanes, Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: thelastoptimist
Reviews.Content: Particularly if you are American, whether you speak French or not, find another hotel. It is a very small boutique with either one of two employees at the desk and they are extremely rude to Americans. The walls of the hotel are filthy. The bedsheets match the wallpaper of the rooms which leads me to believe they must be ages old. The beds are all sunken in in the middle. The elevator only goes up to the 4th floor. We were in a room on the 5 floor so we had to drag our bags up one flight of stairs that was no more than 2 feet wide. We were also traveling with a family that was travelling with one adult and two children. The travel agent that booked the room apparently made a default reservation for two people. The hotel refused to allow them to check into their room which was a two twin bed room because they did not list the third person. They were not allowed to check into the hotel. The receptionist, Isabelle, told them, "One of your children must go!" Unbelievable! Isabelle was so indignant and made several insults about Americans. Also, the area is shady. I cannot warn you enough, DO NOT STAY HERE! As a disclaimer, this is the only negative review, I have ever written on tripadvisor. I usually try to find the best in any situation and tend to do my research pretty well before choosing a hotel, but this was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “This is my review of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: helimike
Reviews.Content: Very clean convenient hotel; decor a little offbeat with a good location and helpful friendly staff. Aircon a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: JuliaV_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks wonderful, and we really enjoyed the room- even though it was tiny, especially the bathroom. We walked to the Sacre Coeur and Montmartre in about 10 mins, and Gare du Nord is only 10 walking mins away as well. Great when arriving by train! Breakfast was fine, service was good. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, but lock up your personal items.”
Reviews.Author: m228
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel during a week's stay in Paris. We booked through Hotwire and were very happy with the location. We were able to walk to all attractions in Paris from here, with Montmartre and the Opera being the closest. There is fairly convenient access to the Metro from the hotel as well as to Gare du Nord. The hotel front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. They always greeted us with a smile and assisted us in booking train travel to other parts of France. The room was a decent size for the 3 of us (2 adults, 1 infant) and the bathroom appeared to be newly renovated. The furnishings in the room were a little worn and the floor could have been cleaner. Overall, the state of the room was not bad. What made our stay frustrating is that my wife was missing several articles of clothing after our stay. We searched the room intensively thinking the missing clothes were under the bed or in a corner somewhere but they were not. We did not remove any clothing from the room during our stay and could even verify that we had these items of clothing in our digital photos (we literally wracked our brains thinking we were wrong). We brought the matter up to the staff and they appeared surprised and concerned, but nothing was done about the matter. We had a little bit of correspondence with the hotel since leaving Paris but nothing has been done. It is a small matter, but could have been much worse had it been passports, money, cameras, etc. that had been taken from the room. Because of this, I do not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again! Clean & beautifully decorated, friendly staff & great location.”
Reviews.Author: MaggiMacG
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with some friends to celebrate my 40th birthday and this hotel was great - the rooms are small but not tiny. Clean. Nice bathrooms with a good shower! The decor makes you feel like you're in an exclusive designer hotel but without the silly prices. It's 8 mins walk from Gare Du Nord so you don't have to battle with taxi drivers as soon as you arrive in Paris! It's 5 minutes walk to the Sacre Couer and Montmatre and about 15 mins to Opera. In fact if you've got your walking shoes on you can pretty much get to most attractions from here. If breakfast is included it's fresh yoghurt, fruit, pain au chocolat, croissant, roll, cheese, jam, honey, marmalade, orange juice. tea/coffee. So not bad at all! AND the staff were really friendly and helpful which make such a difference! Have fun in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “a JEWEL OF DECORATION”
Reviews.Author: nadasurf
Reviews.Content: As a 3 star hotel, it could get a fourth with the decoration..It seems to come from a decoration revue!! Very refind and as you enter this jewel , you feel the cozyness of it! The romms mixes the classic and the modern! The bathroom is very design and the curtains were the most beautiful I have ecver seen! The trouble is when you wake up in such a relaxing atmosphere you do not feel like getting up and wants to keep on being lazy in the soft bed! Breakfast is continantala nd ahs everything you need and served ina very quiet place ...Location is near underground stations Cadet or Peletier....Very convenient when you come from Gare du nord...but there is not much to do in the area..Walk 5 minutes in the direstion of Square d'anvers, You will find plenty of Hip and Chic parisian restaurant and you are also near the funicilaire taking you to Sacre Coeur...

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAOL
Reviews.Content: We didn't want to spend too much on the hotel because when you are in Paris you don't really want to spend much time in your hotel room so we didn't care whether it would have a huge plasma TV with a million of international channels, gym, and some other stuff that a bigger, more expensive hotel would provide. Also, we decided it would be a good idea to save a little on the hotel to be able to spend more on good restaraunts, souvenirs, entertainment, etc. It was a good decision. For $130 per night in July, it's a great choice. Location: not the best, but not the worst either. It's about 15 minutes walk from the Opera house and about 15 minutes walk to Sacre Coeur on Monmartre. The hotel is located on a quiet, safe street, but if you move about several blocks towards Monmartre you would reach a neighborhood with many sex shops and strip joints, which is, while being very picturesque, is probably not the safest place in Paris to walk at night. Rooms: very small, which is typical for Paris, but have stylish new furniture, and very cute and very French overall. The bed was small (and not soft) and the window was facing the street, so we woke up several times because of the street noice. Service: It was good. Some people were more knowledgable and pro-active than others, but overall, everyone was friendly and helpful. Breakfast: typical French. Everyone gets 2 croissants (regular and chocolate), 1 bread roll, 1 crepe, cheese, fruit cup, sour cream, jam, butter, coffee or tea. Other things to know: nearest Metro station is Cadet, which is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Nearest parking garage is also about 5 minutes walk and would cost you 24 euros per 24 hours. You can also park on the street, but it's also paid, and there's often no spots available, and given how people in Paris drive and park, you don't want to risk a rented car. A cab drive from Monmartre to the hotel cost us 9 euros. So after you hang out there near Sacre Coeur, have drinks, and take off at 2am, I wouldn't recommend walking down, but rather taking a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, neat and tidy and just where you want it.”
Reviews.Author: RogerAckroyd
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this great little hotel. They seem to have done a refurb job on the rooms recently and it is much more attractive. A typical small Parisian hotel with about 25 rooms on a reasonably quiet street just 10 minutes walk away from Gare du Nord. The no.42 bus passes the end of the street and that will take you to all the major sites while the nearest Metro is 5 minutes walk away - Poisonniere. The lift is very small and will take just one person. Going up to the third or fourth floor can be a bit of a puff on foot so ask for lower floor accommodation if you don't like lifts (like me) or find stairs a bit of a task. Rooms are clean and tidy and shower bath is small but adequate. Staff very friendly and helpful (and speak English). Breakfast is now better with usual the rolls and croissants but also orange juice, little fruit and yoghurt pots (not shop bought!) and pancakes. Costs 12 Euros which for us Brits at this time is £12.00! Good place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SisselB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend. Good hotelroom size. Typical renessanse look. Bathroom had a modern look tho. Allover very clean. Staff was very helpful and the breakfast great, typical french with crossaints, bread rolls, cheese, jam, coffee, tea, fruit.The best thing about staying here is the location. Montmartre only 5 minutes away, L'opera 10 min away. 30 min to Champs Elysees - hop on the Metro which is close by, only takes about 10 min to Champs Elysees. With Montmartre only 5 min away u can enjoy the endless amount of cafès and restaurant and of course Sacre Cour -bring a bottle of wine and sit down on the stairs leading to Sacre Cour - people watching is great fun! Area around the hotel is great, lots of small shops and restaurants, cafès. In this area u experience the real french atmosphere, I would never have stayed in the area around Champs Elysees, its way too busy and too many tourists. And overpriced! You pay almost double for a cafe creme there. Living close to Montmartre is in my opinion the best choice. And for those who think french are arrogant, think again! The french are very polite and helpful and they do speak english! Tho they do really appreciate if u know some french words, like pardon, s'il vous plait, bon jour, bon soir, merci. I will stay at La Tour D'auvergne next time I visit Paris. FYI; the transport system in Paris is excellent. The Metro will take you anywhere you want to go!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Citytrip”
Reviews.Author: marcevallejo
Reviews.Content: I just came back from 3 nights at the Hotel. Staff super friendly, well located, despite being near to La Gare du nord, I used to arrive around 10pm after a long day of sightseeing and I never felt in danger. Very safe and quiet street. Surely worth it. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeadandShoulders
Reviews.Content: For the price (booked thru bookings.com), the room was really well decorated, comfortable, a decent size and nice and quiet. Bathroom was modern and clean. Location is fine and within easy walk of Montmartre and metro stops. Staff were all helpful and polite. All in all a great stay and I would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Overall - good.”
Reviews.Author: rubber_s0ul
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in August. Overall good value, though it was booked through a discount website. If I had paid full price I would have thought differently. Room was clean - especially the washroom (bonus). We did find the walk to and from Cadet metro station a little tedious - but that was our only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel”
Reviews.Author: jivadent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. The hotel was ok, but nothing more, nothing less either. It was clean, and it's in a decent location, but those were the only good things. The room wasn't spacious, but it wasn't cramped either. The rooms have actual keys (as opposed to hotel key cards) which you have to leave with reception on your way out. That's kind of ok, because you wouldn't want to carry those gigantic things around. The shower wasn't an overhead shower... it was a handheld, and its receptacle was about 2 feet off the ground, so you couldn't stand underneath it. That, plus the fact that there was no shower curtain, made showering there very awkward. The hotel's kind of old too, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: paolof
Reviews.Content: Fairly well located and easy access to Underground at Cadet. If you do not stay in a refurbished room, beware!! Breakfast is adequate but nothing special. Not worth the money you pay but ok if no other option.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a quick Eurostar break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A 5-7 minute stroll away from Gare du Nord, this hotel is a good choice for a Eurostar 1-2 night break from London. We got a great deal on a hotel + train package from the Eurostar website. The hotel has genuinely friendly staff and interesting, quirky decor. Bathrooms appear to vary from the standard Paris neglected look usual to this *** category of hotel to refitted modern chic. Air Conditioning in rooms makes summertime Paris bearable.
